intro: Peristylus setifer, commonly known as the hairy peristylus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically opposite and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its common name. Peristylus setifer is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts well to harsh environmental conditions.
